沙特的官方伊斯兰教派属于逊尼派中的哈奈斐学派，但其教义体系深受18世纪瓦哈比主义（Ikhwan al-Safa运动）影响。这种思想强调严格遵循《古兰经》和圣训原文，反对后来形成的宗教仪式和苏菲派传统。虽然被部分学者视为"原教旨主义"，但这属于逊尼派内部的教义多样性，而非对逊尼派整体的否定。

While the official Saudi Islamic religion belongs to the Hanafi school of Sunnism, its doctrinal system is strongly influenced by the Wahhabism of the eighteenth century (the Ikhwan al-Safa movement). This ideology emphasizes strict adherence to the Koran and hadiths in their original language, and rejects the religious rituals and Sufi traditions that developed later.
